title: The quest for a -slightly- more unholy grail
body:
Let's be frank, grail sucks right now. Outclassed by Morello's as a mana item for casters who rely on spell spam to deal relevant damage. I'm certain some people are quite happy with this, considering that it used to be an item you could buy to forget about your mana pool. That's not something I think needs to come back, it's a bit of a bad concept, even if some of my favorite champions greatly benefited from it. Anthene's unholy grail should be made a decent item that's worth buying, and as such, it should be given something that differentiates it from the rest of the mana/cdr/ap/ items. 

Now, we ask ourselves, why, exactly, is anthene's an *unholy* grail? Clearly, it's a grail filled with blood. It's omnious, cultish, malevolent. If I had to guess, it looked like it was a sacrificial artifact of sorts.

I think you get where I'm going with this.

I propose, that in order to make Anthene's a more thematically complete item, that is also a viable choice, that it should be given an active ability, one that allows the user to sacrifice a portion of their HP for a buff. *Maybe* a toggle, but I think an active ability with a cost would be easier to balance.

I wouldn't quite know what this active would be. It should be something that is obviously geared for sustained damage mages, so i think a damage amp is a bit out of the question, otherwise it'd just be a slightly different version of DFG with a health cost. Perhaps a Cooldown reduction/mana buff? Something that applied bonus cooldown reduction that ignored the cap would be pretty fly, if you asked me.

Maybe I'm iffy on the details, but I think this is an idea that could genuinely give help to an item that got slammed, as well as providing a nice thematic touch to the item.

Thoughts?

replies.body:
You build Grail when you want MR, you build Morello's otherwise. That's it.
It's a fine purchase on Utility mages with shields (i.e.: Orianna and Lulu).

As for the name nitpicking:
Base Item: Chalice of Harmony
Support upgrade: [Crucible](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crucible)
Offensive upgrade: Unholy Grail (originally Chalice of Discord).
The problem with this logic is that Abyssal Scepter clobbers Grail in terms of MR strength.

But Abyssal doesn't give you regen or CDR.
The aura is also mediocre on most mages.

25 MR. Standard mage builds have about 22-23 MPen because of 7.8ish MPen from marks and 15 from boots. Chalice and help negate your MR from becoming negative, but after a Void, you can't even considering the 25 MR even worth being a factor. Most mages have 30 MR through the game. You bring that up to 55 with AUG. Minus 40% after the mid gets a Void, usually a third item... That's 22 knocked off, plus the other 23, they have 10 MR. You get to stay positive! Without it..? They're down by 12 MR from Void, which is 18, minus the 23ish from normal stuff, and you have -5, which doesn't really increase your damage by much, but you're doing true damage practically. So, it's -5 or 10MR. For that 15 MR, you give up on mana regen and 20 AP AND you're paying more gold. Early on, a chalice 'can' help against melee assassins like Fizz and Akali, but most mages who poke you down won't even realize you have the magic resist.

When are you afraid of dying to your magic using lane opponent? Early-midgame.

* Sorc Shoes don't get rushed anymore.
* Void Staff is severely underappreciated compared to Last Whisper and is rarely built before the 40 min mark, if at all.
* Morellonomicon is less lategame regen than Chalice.
* MR cannot go negative from Penetration, only reduction (i.e.: old Starcall).
* Extra damage reduction means more efficient shields.

If you need MR to survive lategame as a squishy caster, you need to work on your positioning.

Void staff is actually a more popular rush item than Rabbadons for getting a huge early game powerspike. Most mages that I see go Regen item into a void staff (Zhonya's if against the likes of Zed) and move on from there.

Unless you have really high base damage, you'll get more out of 2295g of AP than from a Void Staff that early in the game.
Against a 42MR target, we're talking about ~800g for ~14.7 extra MPen. Or ~11% more damage.

Since much of the increase comes from amplifying base damage, it's better to build Void Staff when you have most of your damage spell maxed out. 

tl;dr: Unless your name is Rumble, AP is generally better than Penetration against squishies.

Morellonomicon is only less late-game regen than Chalice when you are low on mana, and the difference in amounts is not meaningful unless you also have a high maximum mana for Mana Font to work off of.

Most will prefer 60 constant mana regen as opposed to 50-70 depending on how low your mana is.
This.
Even so, 25 MR is nothing in practical terms since most mages don't have MR growth.

42MR: 29.5% Damage Reduction.
67MR: 40.1% Damage Reduction.

That's 10.6% less damage taken.
Once you factor in magic penetration, those values become less effective.

Against Flat Pen, you'll always get roughly same damage reduction.

It doesn't lose effectiveness until Void Staff comes into play, much later in the game.

Grail's regen is in a good spot. It's equal to morello's if you hold an average of 60% mana. This does not include the mana on kill/assist. This extra mana makes it the better late game regen item in terms of mana. But this mostly counters the GW passive on morello's. 

It's problem is that it costs 400g more for 25MR.
Following the league wiki
20AP = 435g
25MR = 500g

No where near the 400g gap. 

The other problem is that Chalice costs 1000g. Although it is much stronger than Idol. It has the full mana regen benefits of Athene while Idol has half that of Morello's. But it is 600g. Another 400g gap. 

I'd like to see Athene get buffed to 35MR(this increases it's worth by 200g). And chalice dropped to 800g. This will make Athene cost 2500. 850/2550g is also an option if too good. 

This will put the costs in a more realistic place. The rest is decided by choosing between the extra mana in a teamfight vs reducing healing.

In terms of Regen it is overall in a good spot. Maybe a very slight buff somehow. I think the buff should be in the cost reduction of Chalice. Cost efficiency is in a horrible spot. Even if you want the MR, it's better to just start the MR side of a Specter's Cowl or GA. For an extra 100g over what Athene's cost you can have Morellos and 25MR from Mantle.

I'd just like 5 more magic resist and 25% more base mana regen. Nothing crazy or complicated, nothing that returns it to season 4 levels. But something to make it feel like a worthwhile mana item and still the more defensive one rather than Morello.

The problem with just slapping buffs on athenes is that if you just give it buff to it's current numbers, then the question will once again become 'why buy morellos when you can just have athene's?'.

The items are just way too similar. One will always be better than the other, sans in a few fringe cases (velkoz could easily live on morellonomicon back in s4 because his mana costs are negligible and the additional mana+MR on athene's was rarely worth the extra gold.) unless something is done to differentiate the reasons why you buy them.

1. Remove mana font passive

2. Bump AP up to 80

3. New active costs 10% of current health and restores 10% of missing mana on a 20 sec(ish) CD

4. Tune numbers and increase cost as necessary

The way I see it, there are two problems with a strong Athene's: it makes champions that are balanced around limited mana very strong, and it's the obvious item to rush in the classic AP v. AP midlane.  Introducing an HP-for-Mana conversation seems like it will help with those problems: if the CD is long enough, mana will still be a limiting factor, and if the HP cost is high enough, spamming it on cooldown will have a meaningful price.

EDIT: Keep mana font on Chalice and Mikhail's, those are much less worrisome in midlane and the support doesn't want to be bleeding HP all the time in lane

In short, you want a worse version of the HoN Blood Chalice?

It'd be a bad item. Why would you cut yourself for mana when you can get more mana out of a single Fairy Charm?

It worked in HoN because mana regen values were extremely low, and it was a flat 150 Health for 100 Mana, making it ideal on low mana pools tanky heroes.

Yes, that's exactly what I want, you're right.  I'm also keen on specifically making sure the mana regenerated is a worthless amount to make sure it's a trap for noobs.

How about you comment on the idea of an Athene's with 80 AP lets you cut yourself for mana and don't get too hung up on the numbers?

HoN Blood chalice was a mana item built for tanks
80AP Athenes sounds like a ranged caster item no matter how you look at it.

...Why? Buying an item TO HURT YOURSELF for mana seems really counterproductive, to, i don't know, just buying the freaking mana? Otherwise, if you haven't noticed no items provide negative stats or negative effects for the owners; one of the main reasons is because spending your gold to become weaker or hurt yourself is really unfun, even if the weakness/hurt makes up for great stats.
Except, Dota pulls it off pretty well with Soul Ring, Hell, it's core on a lot of Heroes in Dota.

I never said that the active effect should or would be exclusively for mana sustain. The HP to mana conversion ratio would have to be bonkers for it to be worth the cost. I just said that it ought to be a buff focused on sustained damage mages, since flat damage mps would lead to assasins and burst mages rushing grail.

A huge cooldown buff (not quite urf mode, but maybe something along that vein) would be more along the lines of what I was imagining.

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/Vci86YUJ-buffing-athenes-the-blood-grail

Something like an oom-emergency button - either converting some of your HP to mana or allowing you to cast a single spell for HP instead of mana. Playing on the Blood Grail theme of the item.

Three things they could do that would all make grail a viable option again:
1) Increase the MR back to 40
2) Increase the AP to 80 or 90 (s2 grail, yo)
3) Reduce the cost

Any of these would bring it into line as a viable option.

Have the Unholy Grail siphon health on a toggle. In exchange for siphoning health, the mana regen it gives is increased significantly. Additionally, you gain some amount of spell vamp while it's toggled on.

**Potentially Cool Stuff**:

* Spammy mages can choose what they need more, health or mana.
* Missing a spell has a health cost, while landing a spell reduces the cost.
* Warns the enemy that a spell is likely coming there way (assuming it has a visual like {{item:3042}} )

**Potentially Problematic Stuff**:

* Spell vamp rewards single target spells more than AoE spells. This in turn makes the toggle cost less punishing for targeted abilities like {{champion:1}} or {{champion:45}} 's Q, as oppose to {{champion:115}} , {{champion:101}} , or {{champion:103}} 's Q.

There is no way to not make it feast or famine.
